TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void OpenWriteCompletedEventHandler(object sender, OpenWriteCompletedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed OpenWriteCompletedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a OpenWriteCompletedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates opening a stream to write data to be uploaded.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the stream is available.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_2.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openwriteco_0_2.vb)]
